title: Sepsis Protocol
overview: Early recognition and treatment of sepsis is critical. Apply the Sepsis-3 criteria and initiate the Hour-1 bundle.
steps: Fluid resuscitation: 30 mL/kg crystalloid for hypotension or lactate >= 4
Measure lactate — repeat within 2-4 hours if > 2 mmol/L
doses: OR Meropenem 1g IV Q8H (if high risk)
Add Vancomycin 25-30 mg/kg IV if MRSA risk
redFlags: New organ dysfunction (AKI, coagulopathy, liver failure)

title: Acute Coronary Syndrome
overview: Rapid assessment and treatment of suspected ACS. STEMI requires emergent reperfusion.
steps: Morphine 2-5mg IV for pain if needed
If STEMI: activate cath lab (door-to-balloon < 90 min)

title: Hyperkalemia Protocol
overview: K+ > 6.0 mmol/L or any level with ECG changes requires urgent treatment.
steps: 12-lead ECG — look for peaked T waves, wide QRS, sine wave
If ECG changes: Calcium gluconate 10% 10mL IV over 2 min
Insulin-dextrose: 10 units Actrapid in 50mL 50% dextrose over 15-30 min
doses: Calcium gluconate 10% 10mL (= 2.2 mmol Ca) IV over 2 min
Actrapid insulin 10 units + 50mL 50% glucose IV over 15-30 min
Calcium resonium 15g PO QDS or 30g PR

title: Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA)
overview: DKA: glucose > 11 mmol/L + pH < 7.3 or bicarb < 15 + ketonemia > 3 mmol/L.
steps: IV access x2, bloods (VBG, FBC, U&E, glucose, ketones)
Fluid resuscitation: 0.9% NaCl 1L over 1hr, then reassess
Continue long-acting insulin if already on it
doses: Actrapid 50 units in 50mL 0.9% NaCl at 0.1 units/kg/hr
KCl: if K+ < 3.5 give 40 mmol/L, if 3.5-5.5 give 20 mmol/L, if > 5.5 hold

title: Status Epilepticus
overview: Continuous seizure > 5 min or >= 2 seizures without recovery. Time-critical emergency.
steps: 0-5 min: ABC, high-flow O2, check glucose, IV access
10-20 min: Repeat lorazepam 4mg IV if seizure continues
20-40 min: Phenytoin 20mg/kg IV at max 50mg/min OR levetiracetam 60mg/kg IV
> 40 min: RSI and thiopentone/propofol — call ICU
doses: Lorazepam 0.1 mg/kg IV (max 4mg), repeat once at 10 min
Phenytoin 20 mg/kg IV at max 50 mg/min (with cardiac monitoring)
Midazolam 10mg buccal if no IV access
